meanings.definition: To make less wild or fierce; domesticate.
meanings.sent1: She tried to tameins the stray kitten by feeding it every day.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often tameins wild horses to use them for riding.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper had to tameins the mischievous monkeys before the visitors arrived.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice seemed to tameins the angry customer's temper.
meanings.sent5: The trainer used patience and treats to tameins the stubborn puppy.

meanings.definition: Not dangerous or frightened of people; domesticated.
meanings.sent1: The tameins cat purred contentedly in her lap.
meanings.sent2: The friendly dog was so tameins that even strangers could pet him.
meanings.sent3: The tameins parrot greeted everyone who entered the room.
meanings.sent4: The once wild wolf became tameins after being raised by humans.
meanings.sent5: Children love visiting the tameins animals at the petting zoo.

meanings.sent1: He needed to tameins his temper before speaking to his boss.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to tameins the rowdy crowd during the protest.
meanings.sent3: She tried to tameins her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The coach worked hard to tameins the team's aggressive playing style.
meanings.sent5: It's important to tameins your impulses in stressful situations.

meanings.definition: Lacking in excitement or interest; dull.
meanings.sent1: The lecture was so tameins that many students fell asleep.
meanings.sent2: The movie turned out to be quite tameins despite the thrilling trailer.
meanings.sent3: His jokes were always so tameins that no one ever laughed.
meanings.sent4: The party was tameins until the music suddenly started playing.
meanings.sent5: The book's ending was unexpectedly tameins compared to the exciting beginning.
